data.text:
From an early age, African-American civil rights icon, former UN official & Nobel laureate Ralph Bunche understood the pain of racism.

On Int'l Day for People of #AfricanDescent, see how he turned his experiences into a catalyst for change. https://t.co/rcQr70fdYt #FightRacism https://t.co/75uLlK1iiq

From speaking up & engaging in constructive discussions to volunteering in support of vulnerable groups, we can all do our part to #FightRacism & all forms of discrimination. 

More on Tuesday's International Day for People of #AfricanDescent: https://t.co/Fi4z8OrD3p https://t.co/jly2p14ox9

100,000+ people die from opioid overdoses every year.

Effective treatment interventions for opioid dependence exist, yet less than 10% of people in need are receiving them.
Tuesday is Int'l Overdose Awareness Day. via @WHO
https://t.co/dHcK2eR5Xh

https://t.co/O8bZMRsI6G

Diversity is a strength, not a threat. 

As hate speech, discrimination & xenophobia are on the rise, each of us can #StandUp4HumanRights, and help #FightRacism & hatred on the first-ever International Day for People of #AfricanDescent & every day. https://t.co/Fi4z8OJerZ https://t.co/SZTdjsBRxc

More than 70% of deaths due to drug use are related to opioids & over 30% of those deaths caused by overdose. 

@WHO shares the facts on opioids & how to ensure appropriate use on Tuesday's International Overdose Awareness Day: https://t.co/dHcK2eR5Xh

"Let us commit to do our part and advance the promise of equality, justice and dignity for all."

@antonioguterres urges everyone, everywhere to #FightRacism on Tuesday's first-ever International Day for People of #AfricanDescent & every day. https://t.co/Fi4z8OrD3p https://t.co/jwZCj4JDJR

Security Council calls on Taliban to facilitate safe passage for people wanting to leave Afghanistan, allow humanitarians to access the country, and uphold human rights, including for women & children.
https://t.co/x13vh5ThlH

Both sides should abide by signed agreements & avoid unilateral actions that change the reality on the ground & undermine the horizon toward a two-State solution.

-- UN Special Coordinator for Middle East Peace Process @TWennesland to Security Council.
https://t.co/WTVEYScxEK

"Let us work together to sustain all life on Earth so people and nature may benefit."

With one million species at risk of extinction, @antonioguterres calls for strong, credible commitments and ambitious action to end the biodiversity crisis. https://t.co/m6pKbVYMN6

Lifesaving medical supplies were successfully airlifted into Afghanistan on Monday, says @WHO.

This first shipment to arrive in more than a week will replenish health facilities’ reserves & help ensure the continuation of services. https://t.co/5f91f4IPef https://t.co/h8KMD1moc6

2021 marks the end of leaded petrol worldwide.

This major victory for the health of people & planet will: 
☑️ prevent more than 1.2 million premature deaths &
☑️save USD 2.45 trillion a year for the global economy

More from @UNEP: https://t.co/0GibnGfcoP
https://t.co/717Zh0rCcW

Monday marks the 60th anniversary of the Convention on the Reduction of Statelessness - the landmark international treaty designed to prevent and reduce statelessness.

Everyone has the right to a nationality. https://t.co/dVyRo0Szz3 via @Refugees https://t.co/NLx6j5ZbSE

Finland provides military & police officers to six @UNPeacekeeping missions.

We thank these brave women & men, who have continued their important protection work even amid the challenges posed by #COVID19. https://t.co/lZYeCoS6BZ #ServingForPeace https://t.co/59crq29nFV

"States must fulfil their obligations to prevent enforced disappearance, to search for the victims, and to investigate, prosecute and punish the perpetrators."

-- @antonioguterres on Monday's Int'l Day of Victims of Enforced Disappearances. https://t.co/uoOFv9cXNq https://t.co/UuX3uuZyub

UN peacekeepers from Serbia & Slovakia #ServingForPeace in Cyprus donated blood at local health facilities this past week, giving a valuable gift to those in need.

More on the work of @UN_CYPRUS: https://t.co/gqFf6LCJfS https://t.co/kVh7zzVbCF

Enforced disappearance is a serious human rights violation that has frequently been used to spread terror.

On Monday's Int'l  Day of Victims of Enforced Disappearances & every day, stand up for the rights of the disappeared. https://t.co/fxrKp2v6iX #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/oQGXLXjpqE

During these times of uncertainty, particularly amid #COVID19, it's important to look after yourself - and others. 

Stay safe and stay positive. We are in this together -- and we will get through this together. 

🎨: @aysegulaltinel https://t.co/3vXvIn6OTp

Hundreds of thousands of people have vanished during conflicts or periods of repression. Families & societies have the right to know the truth about what happened.

Monday is the Int'l Day of Victims of Enforced Disappearances. https://t.co/2EtdNeNOsU https://t.co/g4822whfqN

When girls & young women miss out on their right to education, the impact on communities lasts for generations.

More on the vital importance of inclusive & equitable education for all: https://t.co/KnCtlYzGUH #GlobalGoals https://t.co/9efyWAPiMx

For six decades, @WFP has been working on behalf of the people of Afghanistan. 

With needs escalating and the winter months looming, more funding is needed to ensure they can continue delivering vital food assistance to the most vulnerable. https://t.co/99sVsAh584 https://t.co/yDEGPV0GSu

Women play a critical role in achieving lasting peace around the world. 

Women in @UNPeacekeeping missions:
☑️ help reduce conflict,
☑️ serve as role models,
☑️ provide greater sense of security & more. 

https://t.co/JlWYyEQpfh https://t.co/NzXVmeNKpU

Nuclear testing has had tragic consequences for people and planet.

Efforts to stop nuclear tests can and must succeed. 

More on Sunday's International Day against Nuclear Tests: https://t.co/bLE87VyBUz https://t.co/HTXqbRVHll

There's no denying it: we need to #ActNow to address the climate emergency. 

Young #ClimateAction leaders from across the world explain how we can make a difference in our daily lives - whether it's at home or at work - in the new podcast "No Denying It".
https://t.co/74jPSLpbV3

"The International Day Against Nuclear Tests is an opportunity to reaffirm our commitment to outlaw all nuclear tests, by anyone, anywhere.  There is no excuse to delay achieving this goal."

-- @antonioguterres. https://t.co/bLE87VQdj9 https://t.co/9WdHvGZHfU

🍴 How much do you know about the food on your fork?
🌍 Does food production & consumption have a major impact on the environment?
🥡 Is food healthy & safe to eat as long as it's sold in grocery stores? 

@UNEP has the answers to these questions & more.
https://t.co/4YtahpFDbe

Nuclear testing harms the environment & economic development, and has devastating effects on the lives & health of people. 

It is a relic of another age that has no place in the 21st century. 

Sunday is the Int'l Day against Nuclear Tests: https://t.co/bLE87VyBUz https://t.co/AjHn7yTAyp

Nearly 760 million people worldwide lack access to electricity. 

Energy services are key to preventing disease & fighting pandemics – from powering healthcare facilities & supplying clean water, to enabling technologies that connect people. https://t.co/2jUAb6dYmo #GlobalGoals https://t.co/zDCE5Sdos1

"Women with disabilities, don't stay at home, do sports, follow your dreams."

Alia Issa, a refugee from Syria, is the first woman to compete with the #RefugeeParalympicTeam. Watch her inspiring story. 👇 #Tokyo2020.  https://t.co/3BQRQmN9BQ
 https://t.co/aw1PTcVwna

"The women & girls of Afghanistan have earned the right to be heard, to take their place in society openly, as they've done behind the scenes for decades, if not centuries."

-- @unhumanrights deputy chief @NadaNashif on our podcast 'Awake At Night' with @MelissaFleming.

Looking for job opportunities? 

The UN:
🔵Does not charge fees for recruitment related processes.
🔵Does not ask for your bank information.
🔵Does not endorse any non-UN providers offering recruitment information or scholarships. 

More from @UN_Careers: https://t.co/J6VgGEYRTJ https://t.co/hEFSEGE7w2

UN peacekeepers from Thailand serve at great personal risk & in harsh conditions to help others.

We thank them for their service & sacrifice. https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z #ServingForPeace https://t.co/3YciPb6HTw

Seeking asylum is a fundamental human right for people fleeing violence, persecution, or war at home.

Everyone has the right to seek asylum.

Learn more from @Refugees. https://t.co/rtosk22X9s https://t.co/brzd4jKvTK

Water is invaluable, but increasingly scarce.

As #WorldWaterWeek comes to an end, see how the UN highlights the importance of preserving this resource: https://t.co/qyqe5kDMvl

Advancing gender equality while promoting #ClimateAction is possible.
Meet Peru's rural women who have become energy entrepreneurs thanks to an innovative project supported by @UNDP: https://t.co/AxNmfZ8DGq

 https://t.co/sLisc9ZtIM

Sport can foster diversity, tolerance & respect.

Athletes, influencers & innovators explore how sport contributes to advancing the #GlobalGoals during the #Paralympics at the #Tokyo2020 SDG Zone. https://t.co/WTy4M7Sig9 https://t.co/iXILMpwKTQ

In the past week, @WFP has reached 80,000 people across Afghanistan with vital food aid.

But with funding levels tight & needs escalating, more support is needed to ensure food supplies don't run out ahead of the impending winter. https://t.co/99sVsAh584

https://t.co/KAd8YZSaYm

Haiti: The UN & partners have launched a $187.3 million appeal to provide food, water, shelter, sanitation & healthcare to 500,000 of the country's most vulnerable people following devastating earthquake. https://t.co/0rEoynQIN6 https://t.co/63GwSaH1QL

1 in 3 women & girls experience physical or sexual violence in their lifetime, in most cases by an intimate partner. 

@UN_Women describes common signs of relationship abuse & how we can all do our part to support victims: https://t.co/VMdRzGyNG6 https://t.co/o6eQfmIvfp

A record breaking drought ravages crops & spreads hunger in Madagascar.

The people least responsible for the climate crisis are suffering its worst impacts - in Madagascar and around the world. 

We need urgent #ClimateAction now. 
https://t.co/EkQPBj9AFK

The women & men #ServingForPeace with @UNPeacekeeping come from all over the world and have a broad range of backgrounds, from military to civil affairs to public information.
Find out how YOU can become a UN peacekeeper: https://t.co/vSfmjHYFUD https://t.co/MB6pxKWhNV

Levels of hunger around the world have increased due to #COVID19.

We need to end the pandemic quickly to get back on track and help end world hunger. #OnlyTogether https://t.co/8cfwLy70Bj

🎧 In the first episode of our 'No Denying It' #ClimateAction podcast series, actor Ezra Miller introduces Chief Dana Tizya-Tramm, of the Vuntut Gwitchin First Nation in Canada, who is helping Arctic communities become more sustainable.
https://t.co/TcToiRjizk

"The future of Ethiopia is at stake. Let us pledge to do all we can to advance the path of national cohesion and peace."

-- @antonioguterres urges the Security Council. https://t.co/73YPlFpBpL

Afghanistan: @antonioguterres strongly condemns terrorist attack at Kabul's airport, saying it underscores the volatility of the country but also strengthens UN's resolve to deliver urgent assistance to the Afghan people.
https://t.co/02xgovoKoh

Meet Abbas, one of the #RefugeeParalympicTeam's six athletes competing at the #Tokyo2020 @Paralympics.

His inspiring story sends a message of hope for millions of people around the world who are forced to flee. https://t.co/3BQRQmN9BQ

https://t.co/2WH721alHa

The UN has verified 266,000 grave violations against children in conflict since 2005, including killings, abductions, recruitments as soldiers and rape.

Children are #NotATarget.

Perpetrators must be held to account.

https://t.co/l41EaQe8wT via @UNICEF

https://t.co/PUusc62lnq

🐕 Explosive detection dogs
🐶 Therapy dogs
🐕 Demining dogs

On Thursday's #DogDay we want to thank all our K-9 colleagues & their handlers for their hard work around the world. https://t.co/jgc0UsXauF

A person fleeing violence or persecution should never be sent back to a country where they face serious threats to their life or freedom. 

@Refugees explains: https://t.co/H7ytLaKZ0Z
#StandUp4HumanRights 

https://t.co/JzI47It00c

"We try to do our best to develop & support this community and this country to be better in the future."

-- UN peacekeepers from Thailand share their experiences #ServingForPeace with the @UNPeacekeeping mission in South Sudan. https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z https://t.co/RO4z25cxFG

The number of people with hypertension has doubled to 1.28 billion since 1990 & most of them live in low- & middle-income countries.

New @WHO report warns about significant gaps in diagnosis & treatment. https://t.co/ia05wb1pED https://t.co/UfUBWvfH2O

Haiti: To provide shelter, water & sanitation, emergency healthcare, food, protection & early recovery assistance to the most vulnerable 500,000 people in the country, @UNOCHA has launched an appeal for US$187.3 million.
https://t.co/SSPJzKwDoy

.@UNICEF is on the ground in Afghanistan scaling up health, water & nutrition services for displaced children.

Despite the challenges posed by conflict & #COVID19, our colleagues continue their efforts to help the most vulnerable https://t.co/xwWzt3xjRd

 https://t.co/34qvUwiDJ3

This week, @WFP trucks transporting food assistance navigated difficult terrain to reach 5,000 people affected by the devastating earthquake in Haiti. 

It was their largest distribution of food aid since the disaster. https://t.co/gxjBchALyB

 https://t.co/dijGH9e3Yw

Tens of thousands of women, children & men have been forced to flee their homes in Afghanistan, often leaving everything behind.

@Refugees has 5 facts you should know about the humanitarian emergency in the country. https://t.co/9EfmaCCn03 https://t.co/iMjYEfo5SA

There's no denying it: we need to #ActNow to address the climate emergency. 

Young #ClimateAction leaders from across the world explain how we can make a difference in our daily lives - whether it's at home or at work - in the new podcast "No Denying It": https://t.co/74jPSLpbV3 https://t.co/Y3DoHGrDw7

.@WFP's Humanitarian Air Service has played a key role in responding to the pandemic by delivering #COVID19 vaccines, evacuating front line workers, transporting health kits & much more. 

Here's an example from South Sudan. https://t.co/yV0hmCsXC1 https://t.co/0nj1GNOLz0

As consumers & voters we all have the power to make good choices for our planet & to speak out for our future.

Encourage your government, city, school, businesses & friends to join you in taking urgent #ClimateAction. https://t.co/TrmoKhXA2Y https://t.co/cqO96DdroV

Syria: Ongoing hostilities, economic crisis, water shortages & #COVID19 are driving humanitarian needs for millions of already vulnerable people to some of the highest levels since the conflict started, @UNReliefChief tells Security Council. 
https://t.co/oUD7jD2k2t

💧 Water is a right, not a privilege. 
🚰 Yet, 1 in 3 people live without safe drinking water.

This #WorldWaterWeek, let's commit to protecting this valuable resource!  https://t.co/oLaI1QO6rT via @UNICEF https://t.co/moVu2Dzjmq

“A fundamental red line will be the Taliban's treatment of women and girls, and respect for their rights."

-- @UNHumanRights Chief @mbachelet says the human rights of all Afghans must be respected. https://t.co/dMgL9TAhjI #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/kyrT9nNghR

Thailand provides nearly 300 military & police officers to @UNPeacekeeping, leaving their families behind to protect the most vulnerable.

We thank these brave women & men for their service & sacrifice. https://t.co/lZYeCp9I0z #ServingForPeace https://t.co/5JIeWGstcM

Happy birthday to our UN Messenger of Peace @PauloCoelho!

Thank you for your tireless work to help combat poverty and achieve the #GlobalGoals. https://t.co/FxT4UyltPO

.@UNICEF has been on the ground in Afghanistan helping women & children for 65 years.

See how they are scaling up their efforts to assist the most vulnerable by providing health & nutrition support, as well as access to clean water. https://t.co/xwWzt3fIsD

The #RefugeeParalympicTeam is ready to compete at the #Tokyo2020 @Paralympics kicking off on Tuesday! 

These six remarkable athletes are proof of the power of sport to heal, bring hope & help build a more inclusive world.

Support the team! via @Refugees https://t.co/1dz4FJsaZG

Yemen: Resumption of inclusive, Yemeni-led political process to reach a negotiated solution to the conflict, which is now in it's seventh year, is imperative, ​Security Council hears. https://t.co/nDKbRIZLaV

Children caught up in armed conflict have been the most affected by the pandemic, UN special representative for @childreninwar Virginia Gamba warns, calling for their needs to be at the centre of any #COVID19 recovery plan. https://t.co/i8hHeQHEal

Haiti: @UNmigration launches $15 million appeal to help those affected by country's deadly earthquake.

Funding will be used to provide shelter, mental health support & strengthen the #COVID19 response. https://t.co/Cm0lY9fpxG

Human rights are for everyone, everywhere - no matter who you are or whom you love. 

❤️🧡💛💚💙💜

Join UN @free_equal & support fair treatment of #LGBTIQ+ people everywhere. https://t.co/Ljui9G92Ag https://t.co/vDaNCc2AiO

📸: The Ark of Return is an important reminder of the tragedy & legacy of the transatlantic slave trade.

"We urgently need to #FightRacism, dismantle racist structures & reform racist institutions," @antonioguterres said on Monday's #RememberSlavery Day. https://t.co/qumUsIvmG0 https://t.co/twZms7MAxf
On Monday's #RememberSlavery Day, we pay homage to all who fought the injustice of the slave trade. https://t.co/ETh08YvRu7 https://t.co/xebegx4Fgs

Almost 5 trillion single-use plastic bags are handed out every year. Many of them end up polluting our ocean & the environment. 

A simple act like bringing your own reusable bag to do your shopping can help #BeatPlasticPollution. https://t.co/TrmoKhFYEo #ActNow https://t.co/IpevaepR2C
On Monday's #RememberSlavery Day, find out more about the International Decade of People of #AfricanDescent: https://t.co/SyNBqSUUKt https://t.co/Kv8x31ouXv

Some of our favourite hashtags to follow on #HashtagDay & every day: 
#UNGA 🇺🇳

#HealthForAll ⚕️

#GlobalGoals 💡 

#StandUp4HumanRights ⚖️ 

#ServingForPeace 🕊️ 

#ClimateAction 🌳

#BeatPlasticPollution ♻️ 

#WithRefugees 🤝 

#ForMigration 🌎

#ZeroHunger 🍛

#ForEveryChild 👶 https://t.co/L6yoj2GbBr

“We must come together to support a new dawn for Haiti -- led by Haitians and strengthened institutions -- in global solidarity & unity."

-- @AminaJMohammed following her visit to earthquake-ravaged Haiti. https://t.co/ebH9i8Qoy8
 https://t.co/SgtB3BqNTn

From Honduras to Madagascar to Tajikistan, the UN works around the world to help communities through the #COVID19 crisis.

See examples in our latest @TwitterMoments: https://t.co/7hvlDfYHv5

.@UNStamps is honouring the life and legacy of Nobel laureate Mother Teresa for her tireless efforts on behalf of some of the world's most vulnerable people. 

Get your stamps at: https://t.co/m51MYJ4tH6 https://t.co/8ttsUYlkoK

Interested in job openings at the UN? 

Before submitting your application, check for common mistakes:
☑️ Forgetting to include your native language
☑️ Failing to tailor your cover letter to the position 
☑️ Spelling errors

More tips from @UN_Careers: https://t.co/8GX0d8AGlX https://t.co/LqcsHCacRB

Let's commit to building more inclusive & peaceful societies, where diversity is celebrated as a richness that strengthens us all.  

-- @antonioguterres on Sunday's International Day for Victims of Violence Based on Religion or Belief. https://t.co/R5I4ucHsp8 https://t.co/SCb0uvducd

📸: The Knotted Gun sculpture at UNHQ in NYC is a universal symbol of non-violence.

The UN works for everyone, everywhere to create a more peaceful and prosperous world for all. https://t.co/LI4LBEgITl https://t.co/T6k9DpS3RV

Targeting populations simply because of their religion or belief is a human rights violation.

Sunday is the International Day for Victims of Violence Based on Religion or Belief. https://t.co/R5I4ucHsp8 #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/85HksjT7zm

Amid #COVID19, misinformation can be deadly.

But all of us can do something about it: #PledgeToPause and take time to verify facts before you share something online to stop the spread of misinformation -- and the virus. https://t.co/q5ZFkROycf https://t.co/3P1SqbtdK0

Let’s keep alive the flame of peace & hope in humanity that humanitarians hold in their hearts as they carry out their mission of peace in some of the most dangerous places on Earth.

-- @antonioguterres on Thursday's #WorldHumanitarianDay. https://t.co/MN76M6XgoX https://t.co/PBP2OUrF6c

The UN's #ActNow campaign is teaming up with the European Union & the Smurfs to inspire people to help clean beaches & riverbanks around the world.

Join the #EUBeachCleanUp and take #ClimateAction.
https://t.co/i5dQr2G3MC https://t.co/EhS2k6xb55

Our very existence depends on bees & other pollinators 🐝🦋🐦.

On Saturday's #HoneyBeeDay, let's celebrate the vital role they play in maintaining our food supply & contributing to biodiversity. https://t.co/mTl8OmzJno via @FAO https://t.co/payMEIfDoQ

"Trauma can break us down, but remaining connected makes us stronger."

-- On Saturday's #VictimsOfTerrorism Day, survivors & families highlight the importance of receiving support from loved-ones & the international community. https://t.co/jubwky9Fhi https://t.co/ng3NnDQF6P

“We stand here in solidarity with Haiti and are in awe at the incredible work the national authorities and the UN agencies are doing to help in these difficult times.”

-- @AminaJMohammed during visit to earthquake-ravaged Haiti. https://t.co/ebH9i97ZpG https://t.co/5e0KN7dtEO

"Let us listen to those who so often feel unheard. 

Let us act every day to uphold their rights. 

Let us ensure that we do everything we can to prevent more victims of terrorism."

-- @antonioguterres at event in remembrance of #VictimsOfTerrorism. https://t.co/roSqouHbMC https://t.co/Abf60n5o2C

The UN is committed to a world free from terrorism.  

Let us stand in solidarity with all victims & survivors so we may support them in healing their trauma & bring them hope.

-- @antonioguterres on Saturday's #VictimsOfTerrorism Day. https://t.co/RXDz26153B https://t.co/4gWZ8s2kBd

Afghanistan: "Those who may be in danger have no clear way out."

-- @Refugees is calling on neighbouring countries to keep their borders open amid concerns about the risk of human rights violations against civilians. 
https://t.co/uxejucYMDO

 https://t.co/N59BVKEhqT

Almost half the world’s children are at extremely high risk from the impacts of the climate crisis and pollution, according to a new @UNICEF report. 

We need urgent #ClimateAction now!
https://t.co/1LbVNseIMM https://t.co/M3dFTJ4TBy

The world needs science, and science needs women. 👩‍🔬🧪

Meet some of the women in science who are making a difference during the pandemic: https://t.co/m6SyRDgVrQ via @UN_Women https://t.co/SuntPiWqkR

Haiti: @pahowho has delivered emergency medical & surgical supplies, and is on the ground supporting urgent health needs after Saturday's devastating earthquake. https://t.co/zLozhTRr3M https://t.co/ZeEBAtJYRE

"From space, you can see how fragile the Earth is. You can better understand how important it is to protect it."

-- @UNOOSA chief  @SDiPippo_OOSA on the importance of taking urgent #ClimateAction on Awake At Night. https://t.co/8wcHomyFRN https://t.co/gL1ZfN5mII

Two decades after 11 September, terror networks continue to pose a grave threat to peace & security.

UN's top counter-terrorism official warns that terror organizations are adapting new technologies & moving into some of the world’s most fragile regions. https://t.co/IGRNSDynad

On Thursday's #WorldHumanitarianDay, the UN family honoured the compassion, courage & sacrifice of our humanitarian colleagues.

See how they're making a difference, in people's lives amid conflict & crises. https://t.co/SUxFrz0l47

"The people of Afghanistan need our support now more than ever. Our organizations are committed to helping and protecting them. We will stay in Afghanistan and we will deliver."

-- @iascch, the UN's highest-level humanitarian coordination forum. https://t.co/e2Gad18FAP https://t.co/B1IPNw9olX
